meanings.definition: Existing or most common at a particular time
meanings.sent1: The prevailing fashion trend this season is floral patterns.
meanings.sent2: The prevailing opinion among the group was to go to the beach.
meanings.sent3: Despite the prevailing rain, the picnic went on with umbrellas and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like the prevailing sunshine, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The prevailing smell of fresh bread from the bakery made everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: Having the most influence or control
meanings.sent1: The prevailing leader in the company made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: His prevailing presence in the room commanded attention from all.
meanings.sent3: The prevailing cat ruled the neighborhood, demanding treats from everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her prevailing charisma drew people towards her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The prevailing teacher guided the students with wisdom and care.

meanings.definition: Proving superior in strength or influence
meanings.sent1: The prevailing team won the championship with ease.
meanings.sent2: His prevailing argument convinced everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The prevailing wind carried the kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her prevailing determination led her to achieve her goals against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The prevailing scent of her perfume lingered in the room long after she left.
